TopicTitle: KSP downloaded with Steam selected - can I now eliminate the annoying Steam Log in steps?

Articles.Content: I recently purchased KSP and in so doing I checked a box "Steam" while downloading the program, not knowing what Steam is.   Now when ever I want to start KSP I must go through the unneeded steps of putting in a Steam password and a code from the Steam Authenticator App on my iPhone.  Is there anyway I can eliminate the Steam log in steps and just launch KSP without need of log in and passwords?  Ideally, I'd like a shortcut on my desktop that immediately launches KSP.

Hello, and welcome to the forums! 

Moving your question to Technical Support.

27 minutes ago, xomckeever said:

I recently purchased KSP and in so doing I checked a box "Steam" while downloading the program, not knowing what Steam is.   Now when ever I want to start KSP I must go through the unneeded steps of putting in a Steam password and a code from the Steam Authenticator App on my iPhone.  Is there anyway I can eliminate the Steam log in steps and just launch KSP without need of log in and passwords?  Ideally, I'd like a shortcut on my desktop that immediately launches KSP.

Fortunately, KSP doesn't actually depend on Steam to run, once it's been installed locally.  So you can just put a shortcut straight to KSP_x64.exe on your desktop, and start with that.  It'll work just fine and won't involve Steam or logging in or anything.

Assuming that you've installed it the default location that Steam likes to use, then on a Windows machine, it'll most likely be located in the following folder:

C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program

(or whatever your system drive is, if it's not C:)
